name: aws-workbench
description: Your complete AWS toolkit, right in VS Code

commands.title: Aws Access:Test Aws Connectivity With Active User
Aws Access:Copy Credentials To Default Profile

view/item/context.when: view == AwsWorkbenchTree && viewItem =~ /#Type:StepFunctions#/ && (viewItem =~ /StepFunc#/ || viewItem =~ /#TriggerGroup#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerSavedPayload#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerWithPayload#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerFilePayload#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerNoPayload#/)

view == AwsWorkbenchTree && viewItem =~ /#Type:Lambda#/ && (viewItem =~ /Lambda#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerConfig#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerSavedPayload#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerWithPayload#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerFilePayload#/ || viewItem =~ /TriggerNoPayload#/)

viewsWelcome.contents:
Please click [+] to add Aws Resources. 
 [Add](command:aws-workbench.addResource) 



 To Access Aws, you need to configure local Aws Credentials. 
 For more detail on Aws Credentials, see the [AWS CLI Credentials Documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/cli-configure-files.html). 
 For a video guide, see this [YouTube Tutorial on AWS Credentials](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SON8sY1iOBU). 

 [Test Aws Connection](command:aws-workbench.TestAwsConnection) 

 [Update Aws EndPoint](command:aws-workbench.UpdateAwsEndPoint)

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
